result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron B VanDyke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will grant early discharge after 2 years upon Agent's application to the Court and if all conditions have been completed.
**Amended 2/27/17 to grant huber privileges only for purposes of treatment program participation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or obtain his GED/HSED or its equivalent.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he believes such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.  
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions and any appointments with health care providers.
**Amended 2/27/17 to grant huber privileges only for purposes of treatment program participation.

timeConds.notes:
6 months stayed.
Regarding the remaining 6 months - Defendant to serve the first 5 days of each month commencing 7/1/16.  At the end of one year, if defendant is in compliance with all conditions, the balance will be stayed.
Defendant can serve in Outagamie County.
Defendant can serve on electronic monitoring, if allowed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
